text:
CNN â€”

The White House is making clear it views President Donald Trumpâ€™s Friday Oval Office showdown with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky as an overwhelming win that underscores Trumpâ€™s â€œAmerica firstâ€ leadership, dispatching top officials and allies to amplify Trumpâ€™s handling of the situation even as European leaders are expressing unified support for Ukraine and its leader.

Trump often took aim at US aid for Ukraine on the campaign trail, reflecting waning support among Americans for Ukraine and Zelensky over the past three years of the war. Trump views the conflict through an economic lens, seeking to rebuild a partnership with Russia and recoup some of the financial support the US has provided to Ukraine.

The presidentâ€™s top lieutenants, including Secretary of State Marco Rubio, national security adviser Mike Waltz, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick â€” all of whom were in the Oval Office during the explosive meeting â€” appeared on news shows Sunday to offer praise to their boss and criticism of his Ukrainian counterpart as Trump is dramatically reshaping US alliances.

The efforts come as dozens of European leaders are gathering in London for what British Prime Minister Keir Starmer described as a â€œonce-in-a-generation moment for the security of Europe,â€ a major show of support for Zelensky.

European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, Finnish President Alexander Stubb, France's President Emmanuel Macron, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer, Zelensky, Romania's Interim President Ilie Bolojan, European Council President Antonio Costa and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau at a summit in central London on March 2, 2025. Justin Tallis/Pool/AFP/Getty Images

â€œI hope you know that we are all with you and the people of Ukraine for as long as it takes, everyone around this table,â€ Starmer said in opening remarks at the Sunday summit.

Trumpâ€™s team, meanwhile, is doubling down, framing the contentious Friday meeting from a position of US strength, even as it has been met with glee by the Kremlin.

During an appearance on â€œState of the Union,â€ Waltz indicated US support for new leadership in Ukraine.

â€œWe need a leader that can deal with us, eventually deal with the Russians and end this war,â€ Waltz told CNNâ€™s Dana Bash on Sunday.

â€œAnd if it becomes apparent that President Zelenskyâ€™s either personal motivations or political motivations are divergent from ending the fighting in this country, then I think we have a real issue on our hands,â€ Waltz said.

House Speaker Mike Johnson also suggested in an appearance on NBCâ€™s â€œMeet the Pressâ€ that Zelensky should potentially step aside after the tense meeting, saying, â€œEither he needs to come to his senses and come back to the table in gratitude, or someone else needs to lead the country to do that.â€

Trump himself suggested after the meeting that Zelensky does not want an end to the war. Waltz said Sunday that the Ukrainian leader needs to make it clear â€œpublicly and privatelyâ€ that he is â€œready to go to peace.â€

Waltz, who compared Zelensky to an â€œex-girlfriend that just wants to argueâ€ earlier in the weekend, continued to slam the Ukrainian leaderâ€™s Friday actions and body language, castigating â€œthe shaking of the head, the kind of â€” the arms crossed, we just â€” we found it incredibly disrespectful.â€

Rubio also went after Zelensky, who, he said on ABC Newsâ€™ â€œThis Week,â€ â€œfound every opportunity to try to â€˜Ukraine-splainâ€™ on every issue.â€

And Lutnick cast Trump as â€œthe peacemaker.â€

â€œHeâ€™s the peacemaker, and if Zelensky is not interested in peace, then he should go home and think about it,â€ he told Fox Newsâ€™ â€œSunday Morning Futures.â€

Zelensky, Trump, and Vance at the White House on Friday, February 28, 2025. Jim Lo Scalzo/EPA/Bloomberg via Getty Images

The White House press office has also sent multiple emails amplifying warm reviews and messages of support from key Republican allies on Capitol Hill, members of Trumpâ€™s Cabinet and other top White House officials.

â€œSupport continues to roll in for the unwavering commitment of President Donald J. Trump and Vice President Vance to the American people and the Trump Administrationâ€™s relentless pursuit of peace,â€ an email sent to reporters Saturday said, highlighting remarks from Johnson praising Trump for â€œputting America firstâ€; from Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard thanking Trump for his â€œunwavering leadershipâ€; and from Sen. Eric Schmitt of Missouri asserting that â€œthe age of â€˜America lastâ€™ foreign policy is over,â€ among others.

Johnson, who spearheaded an effort to pass more aid to Ukraine last spring despite threats to his speakership from some hardliners in his own party, told Bash he had done so to â€œallow Ukraine to sustain itself and position them for peace negotiationsâ€ by extending support until Trump took office.

â€œThe plan worked, but now Zelensky has to follow through, and the fact that he acted as he did, I think, was a great disappointment,â€ the Louisiana Republican said.

He said an assessment by Sen. Lisa Murkowski, a frequent GOP critic of the president, that the Trump administration was â€œwalking away from our allies and embracing Putin,â€ was â€œplainly wrong,â€ arguing that Trump, who has hesitated to call Putin a â€œdictator,â€ has been â€œvery clearâ€ that the Russian president is an aggressor in Ukraine.

Former House Intelligence Committee Chair Mike Turner, historically an avid supporter of Ukraine and hardliner on Russia, called Zelenskyâ€™s actions during the meeting with Trump â€œinappropriate.â€

â€œYou got to hear President Trump. I mean â€¦ he engaged by saying, you know, people are dying,â€ the Ohio Republican congressman said on CBSâ€™ â€œFace the Nation.â€ â€œWe need to stop the dying. â€¦ Letâ€™s go forward with the peace negotiations, and then weâ€™ll determine what security arrangements need to be made around the peace negotiations.â€
title: White House amplifies rave reviews for Trumpâ€™s handling of Zelensky showdown as Europe rallies around Ukraine

text:
Kane Williamson is a player who loves to remain calm and focused on the field and doesn't engage with opposition cricketers much. But a different scenario was witnessed during the India vs New Zealand ICC Champions Trophy 2025 match when Kane was spotted engaging in a friendly banter with Hardik Pandya. As Hardik crunched a shot to the point area, Williamson stopped and then hilariously made gestures towards him mimicking martial arts moves. Fans loved the banter and made it viral on social media. Kane Williamson Takes One-Handed Grab to Dismiss Axar Patel During IND vs NZ ICC Champions Trophy 2025 Match (Watch Video).
Kane Williamson Makes Hilarious Gestures
Kane Williamson after stopping the ball hit by Hardik Pandya ğŸ˜‚ pic.twitter.com/nQCBSnihwO â€” Radha (@Rkc1511165) March 2, 2025

The above post is embeded directly from the user's social media account and LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body. The views and facts appearing in the social media post do not reflect the opinions of LatestLY, also LatestLY does not assume any responsibility or liability for the same.)
title: Kane Williamson Makes Hilarious Gestures After Stopping Hardik Pandya's Cracking Shot During IND vs NZ ICC Champions Trophy 2025 Match (Watch Video)

text:
Oscar statues stand in front of the Dolby Theatre ahead of the 97th Annual Academy Awards in Hollywood, California on March 1, 2025.

The 97th Academy Awards are live from the Dolby Theater in Hollywood. The ceremony, hosted by comedian Conan O'Brien and with announcements by Nick Offerman, airs on ABC and is available to stream on Hulu.

This year's awards put a handful of new records on the line: "The Brutalist" star Adrien Brody could be the first to go 2-for-2 in the best actor category, while TimothÃ©e Chalamet could unseat Brody as the youngest winner in the category if he takes the statue for "A Complete Unknown."

Two musicals are up for best picture â€” "Wicked" and "Emilia PÃ©rez" â€” alongside "Anora," "The Brutalist," "A Complete Unknown," "Conclave," "Dune: Part Two," "I'm Still Here," "Nickel Boys" and "The Substance."

"Wicked" stars Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo opened the ceremony, performing a trio of Oz-related songs. Watch the full performance below.

The adaptation picked up one of the early wins of the night for best costume design, inking Paul Tazewell as the first Black man to win the award in the Academy's history.

Diversity shone throughout the evening: "Flow" became the first Latvian film to claim an Academy Award, winning best animated feature; the filmmakers behind "In the Shadow of the Cypress" â€” which took home best animated short â€” are Iranian; and Zoe Saldana became the first American of Dominican descent to win an Oscar, hoisting a statue for her role in Netflix's "Emilia PÃ©rez."

"No Other Land," named best documentary film, tracks the expulsion of communities from the West Bank by the Israeli military and comes from a collective of Palestinian and Israeli filmmakers.

Here's the full list of 2025 Oscar winners:

Best supporting actor: Kieran Culkin, "A Real Pain"

Best animated feature: "Flow"

Best animated short: "In the Shadow of the Cypress"

Best costume design: Paul Tazewell, "Wicked"

Best original screenplay: Sean Baker, "Anora"

Best adapted screenplay: Peter Straughan, "Conclave"

Best makeup and hairstyling: Pierre-Olivier Persin, StÃ©phanie Guillon and Marilyne Scarselli, "The Substance"

Best editing: Sean Baker, "Anora"

Best supporting actress: Zoe Saldana, "Emilia PÃ©rez"

Best production design: Nathan Crowley and Lee Sandales, "Wicked"

Best original song: "El Mal" from "Emilia PÃ©rez"

Best documentary short: "The Only Girl in the Orchestra"

Best documentary feature: "No Other Land"

Best sound: "Dune: Part Two"

Best visual effects: "Dune: Part Two"

Best live-action short: "I'm Not a Robot"

Best cinematography: Lol Crawley, "The Brutalist"

Best international feature: "I'm Still Here" (Brazil)
title: Oscars 2025 live updates: Zoe Saldana wins for 'Emilia PÃ©rez,' 'Wicked' takes home design awards
